page.title: 03Changing times 1945-1985 (2)
page.content: Prices in Edenbridge were dearer than in the other nearby towns. In the 1960's-70's people were friendly to each other and were welcomed into the town. There was more horse riding and people were dependant on fresh foods. They had televisions and single tub washing machines. Freezer cabinets were extra on refridgerators. Local people interviewed recalled V.E. Day with mixed feelings. Others remembered the floods in the town. The Four Elms vicarage was sold in 1982. The village pond used to be a pit, the earth was used for the housing estates. 4 of which have been built since 1945. There has always been a P.O., butchers, & a grocers, now there are also 2 antique shops and a garage built in 1960. The Chapel was built in 1931. There are twlage halls and also a Public house.
